The Mingled Spirit
In the beginning, when God created the heavens and the earth, He also created man. The Bible says, â€œGod created man in His own imageâ€ (Genesis 1:27). That is very important. To be made in Godâ€™s image means we are not just like animals, trees, or stars. We were created to reflect who God is.
Who is Godâ€™s image? The Bible tells us clearly that Christâ€”Jesus Himselfâ€”is the image of God (2 Corinthians 4:4; Colossians 1:15). So when God made man, He made us to match Christ.
But God did not only make us to look like Him. He made us for something more. Romans 9:21 explains that God made us as vessels. A vessel is like a cup or a bottle. Think about it: what is the purpose of a cup? Not to do work by itself, but to hold something inside. In the same way, you and I were not made just to work hard for God. We were made to contain God inside us.
Now letâ€™s look closer. God gave us something very specialâ€”our human spirit. In Genesis 2:7 we read that God formed manâ€™s body from the dust of the ground. Then God breathed into man the breath of life, and man became a living soul. That breath was not just air. It was Godâ€™s breath, and it became manâ€™s spirit.
Job 32:8 says, â€œThere is a spirit in man, and the breath of the Almighty gives them understanding.â€ Proverbs 20:27 adds, â€œThe spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord.â€ Together these verses show us that manâ€™s spirit is like a lamp inside of us, lit by Godâ€™s own breath.
So man is made of three parts: body, soul, and spirit (1 Thessalonians 5:23). The body is our outside frame. The soul is our personalityâ€”our mind, feelings, and will. But the deepest and most important part is the spirit, where Godâ€™s life can live.
Hereâ€™s an example: a radio looks nice on the outside, but if it does not have a receiver inside, it cannot pick up any sound. Our body is like the box of the radio, but our spirit is the receiver. Without the receiver, the radio is silent. Without our spirit, we cannot connect with God.
The prophet Zechariah said something amazing (Zechariah 12:1). He said that God made three great things: the heavens, the earth, and the spirit of man. The heavens are for the earth. The earth is for man. And manâ€™s spirit is for God. That is the purpose of the universe. The heavens above us were made so the earth could exist. The earth was made so that man could live. And man was made so that God could live in manâ€™s spirit.
This is why man is called a God-bottle. We are empty without Him. Education, food, clothing, entertainmentâ€”these things may fill our time, but they cannot fill our spirit. Only God can fill our spirit. And since God is Spirit (John 4:24), only our spirit can truly receive Him.
Without God, the universe feels empty. Without our spirit, life has no meaning. But with God living in our spirit, suddenly life has purpose, joy, and light.

When we believe in Jesus and are baptized into Him, something amazing happens. Jesus comes into us, and we are placed into Him. He lives in us, and we live in Him. How is this possible? The answer is simple but powerful: the two spirits become one.

1 Corinthians 6:17 tells us, â€œHe who is joined to the Lord is one spirit.â€ This is not just a theoryâ€”it is a fact. Deep inside you, the Spirit of God and your human spirit are mingled together as one.

In the same way, when we sin, it becomes like insulation between us and God. But when we confess and repent, the barrier is removed, and His Spirit flows freely in us again.
This shows us that the Christian life is not only about learning doctrines, but about experiencing Christ as life every day.
